thread.title: Owls Claim Coconut Hoops Title Behind Career-High from Cottle
thread.title_full: Owls Claim Coconut Hoops Title Behind Career-High from Cottle

author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Owls Claim Coconut Hoops Title Behind Career-High from Cottle
text:
Owls Claim Coconut Hoops Title Behind Career-High from Cottle
The Kennesaw State Owls claimed the Coconut Hoops title with a thrilling 102-100 overtime victory against FGCU in Fort Myers, matching their highest point total in a Division I game. The Owls extended their winning streak over FGCU to four games, improving to 5-2 this season. Simeon Cottle was a standout, achieving a career-high of 33 points and excelling at the free-throw line during crucial moments. KSU's perfect shooting in the overtime period was pivotal in clinching the win.
- KSU shot 50.8% from the field (32-of-63) and made 29-of-36 free throws for 80.6% accuracy.
- Cottle scored 33 points, with 11 points coming in overtime, and was 14-of-14 from the free-throw line.
- KSU has now won four consecutive games against FGCU, including three straight at Alico Arena.
- With this victory, the Owls are 5-1 in overtime games under Coach Antoine Pettway over the past three seasons.
The Owls will return home to Kennesaw for a three-game homestand, starting with a match against Jackson State on December 2, streamed live on ESPN+.
Bottom LineKennesaw State's impressive performance underscores their potential this season, particularly with players like Cottle stepping up in critical moments. The team's ability to win close games will be essential as they continue their campaign.
Read more at Kennesaw State University Athletics
